Description: A string of twenty-two drop-shaped pendants: ten of chalcedony, the remainder of lapis lazuli, all bound with gold. They are all of cut and polished stone with rounded bases and pointed tops. A hole for the thread is pierced near the pointed top. There is a narrow strip of gold foil wrapped around the maximum circumference. The chalcedony is a milky white in colour with red veining. Some of the pendants are also tinged with green, a natural variation.
Curator's comments: Budge, in E. A. Wallis Budge, 'The Mummy: a Handbook of Egyptian Funerary Archaeology' (Cambridge 1925), 267 dates this string to the New Kingdom. Bibliography: The British Museum, 'A Guide to the Third and Fourth Egyptian Rooms' (London, 1904), 213, no. 768; E. A. Wallis Budge 'A Guide to the Fourth, Fifth and Sixth Egyptian Rooms, and the Coptic Room' (London, 1922), no. 768; E. A. Wallis Budge, 'The Mummy: a Handbook of Egyptian Funerary Archaeology' (Cambridge 1925), 267.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (555)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
